question: If you took all of the atoms out of a chair, what would be left?
candidate_answers: (A) The chair would still be there, but it would weigh less. (B) The chair would be exactly the same as it was before. (C) There would be nothing left of the chair. (D) Only a pool of liquid would be left on the floor.
answer: There would be nothing left of the chair.
label: C
